Detailed Description

Main class of the RS232-protcol.

boolean  debug

This is a constructor

Parameters:
poort This is a String indicating the type of port you want. e.g. "COM1"
baudRate This is the baudRate used for communication (e.g. 115200)
debug Make this boolean true if you want debug info, otherwise make this boolean false;

Member Function Documentation

void LieBTrau::comm::NeoRS232::addActionListener (  ActionListener  actionListener  )  [inline]
 

If you want that your class does something when data comes in, then you have to add an ActionListener using this method. The implementing ActionListener-class should contain a method actionPerformed. This method will be called when data comes in.

See also:
java.awt.event.ActionListener
Parameters:
actionListener an object of a class that implements the ActionListener class.

void LieBTrau::comm::NeoRS232::bewerkDatagram (  ArrayList  inputBuffer  )  [inline, package]
 

This function gets called when a complete frame has been received. It sends the transmitter an acknowledge when data is received correctly. It also passes the data on to a higher OSI-layer.

Parameters:
inputBuffer Buffer containing data to send.

byte [] LieBTrau::comm::NeoRS232::getData (   )  [inline]
 

Call this function to get the received data

void LieBTrau::comm::NeoRS232::schrijfData (  byte[]  data  )  [inline]
 

Use this function to write data to the port

Parameters:
data A byte-array containing the bytes to be sent. Don't use large arrays, because you will flood the receiver.

void LieBTrau::comm::NeoRS232::sluitPoort (   )  [inline]
 

This function closes the communications port. Call this function before closing your application. Otherwise the port remains open and you won't get the message: "Press any key to continue..."
